techs.name: Agriculture
techs.quote: 'Where tillage begins, other arts follow. The farmers therefore are the founders of human civilization.' - Daniel Webster

techs.name: Pottery
techs.quote: 'Shall the clay say to him that fashioneth it, what makest thou?' - Bible Isaiah 45:9

techs.name: Trapping
techs.quote: 'Even brute beasts and wandering birds do not fall into the same traps or nets twice.' - Saint Jerome

techs.name: Mining
techs.quote: 'The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.' - J. Paul Getty

techs.name: Sailing
techs.quote: 'He who commands the sea has command of everything.' - Themistocles

techs.name: Calendar
techs.quote: 'So teach us to number our days, so that we may apply our hearts unto wisdom.' - Bible Psalms 90:12

techs.name: Archery
techs.quote: 'The haft of the arrow has been feathered with one of the eagle's own plumes, we often give our enemies the means of our own destruction' - Aesop

techs.name: Masonry
techs.quote: 'How happy are those whose walls already rise!' - Virgil

techs.name: Optics
techs.quote: 'He made an instrument to know if the moon shine at full or no.' - Samuel Butler

techs.name: Writing
techs.quote: 'He who destroys a good book kills reason itself.' - John Milton

techs.name: Domestication
techs.quote: 'A Horse! A Horse! My kingdom for a horse!' - Shakespeare (Richard III)

techs.name: The Wheel
techs.quote: 'Wisdom and virtue are like the two wheels of a cart.' - Japanese proverb

techs.name: Construction
techs.quote: 'Three things are to be looked to in a building: that it stands on the right spot; that it be securely founded; that it be successfully executed.' - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

techs.name: Bronze Working
techs.quote: 'Here Hector entered, with a spear eleven cubits long in his hand; the bronze point gleamed in front of him, and was fastened to the shaft of the spear by a ring of gold.' - Homer

techs.name: Philosophy
techs.quote: 'There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.' - Socrates

techs.name: Poetry
techs.quote: 'What is drama but life with the dull bits cut out.' - Alfred Hitchcock

techs.name: Mathematics
techs.quote: 'Mathematics is the gate and key to the sciences.' - Roger Bacon

techs.name: Iron Working
techs.quote: 'Do not wait to strike til the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.' - William Butler Yeats

techs.name: Theology
techs.quote: 'Three things are necessary for the salvation of man: to know what he ought to believe; to know what he ought to desire; and to know what he ought to do' - St. Thomas Aquinas

techs.name: Civil Service
techs.quote: 'The only thing that saves us from the bureaucracy is its inefficiency' - Eugene McCarthy

techs.name: Currency
techs.quote: 'Better is bread with a happy heart than wealth with vexation.' - Amenemope

techs.name: Engineering
techs.quote: 'Instrumental or mechanical science is the noblest and, above all others, the most useful.' - Leonardo da Vinci

techs.name: Metal Casting
techs.quote: 'When pieces of bronze or gold or iron break, the metal-smith welds them together again in the fire, and the bond is established.' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Compass
techs.quote: 'I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving.' - Oliver Wendell Holmes

techs.name: Education
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to science
techs.quote: 'Education is the best provision for old age.' - Aristotle

techs.name: Chivalry
techs.quote: 'Whoso pulleth out this sword of this stone and anvil, is rightwise king born of all England.' - Malory

techs.name: Guilds
uniques: Enables conversion of city production to gold
techs.quote: 'The merchants and the traders have come; their profits are pre-ordained...' - Sri Guru Granth Sahib

techs.name: Machinery
techs.quote: 'The press is the best instrument for enlightening the mind of man, and improving him as a rational, moral and social being.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Physics
techs.quote: 'Measure what is measurable, and make measurable what is not so.' - Galileo Galilei

techs.name: Steel
techs.quote: 'John Henry said to his Captain, / 'A man ain't nothin' but a man, / And before I'll let your steam drill beat me down, / I'll die with the hammer in my hand.'' - Anonymous: The Ballad of John Henry, the Steel-Drivin' Man

techs.name: Alchemy
techs.quote: 'Wherever we look, the work of the chemist has raised the level of our civilization and has increased the productive capacity of the nation.' - Calvin Coolidge

techs.name: Acoustics
techs.quote: 'Their rising all at once was as the sound of thunder heard remote' - Milton

techs.name: Loans and Saving
techs.quote: 'Happiness: a good bank account, a good cook and a good digestion' - Jean Jacques Rousseau

techs.name: Metallurgy
techs.quote: 'There never was a good knife made of bad steel.' - Benjamin Franklin

techs.name: Astronomy
uniques: Enables embarked units to enter ocean tiles
techs.quote: 'Joyfully to the breeze royal Odysseus spread his sail, and with his rudder skillfully he steered.' - Homer

techs.name: Gunpowder
techs.quote: 'The day when two army corps can annihilate each other in one second, all civilized nations, it is to be hoped, will recoil from war and discharge their troops.' - Alfred Nobel

techs.name: Fertilizer
techs.quote: 'The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself.' - Franklin Delano Roosevelt

techs.name: Economics
techs.quote: 'Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Navigation
techs.quote: 'The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.' - Edward Gibbon

techs.name: Scientific Theory
techs.quote: 'Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.' - John Dewey

techs.name: Cultivication
techs.quote: 'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.' - George S. Patton

techs.name: Railroads
techs.quote: 'The introduction of so powerful an agent as steam to a carriage on wheels will make a great change in the situation of man.' - Thomas Jefferson

techs.name: Archaeology
techs.quote: 'Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.' - George Santayana

techs.name: Telepathy
techs.quote: 'Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.' - John Dewey

techs.name: Foresight
techs.quote: 'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.' - George S. Patton
